alert.note: Alert for Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 01 at 2:48AM MDT until August 01 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Teller and El Paso Counties * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain producing thunderstorms will redevelop this afternoon across the Pikes Peak region and will be capable of producing rainfall rates of up to 2 inches per hour. This could quickly result in flash flooding, especially for areas with saturated soil conditions from rainfall yesterday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Teller County, Rampart Range above 7500fT, Pike's Peak Between 7500 And 11000 Ft
